net.jenet

Class Host

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jenet.Host

  • public class Host
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base class used for UDP packet communications.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Host

        public Host(java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
    int maxConnections,
    int incomingBandwith,
    int outgoingBandwith)
     throws java.io.IOException,
            org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Creates a new Host object. If the incoming/outgoing bandwidths are not bounded, the host will drop unreliable packets in order to keep them below the fixed limits. This parameter also influences the number and size of the reliable packets that may be handled at once.
        Parameters:
        address - The to bind this host to (ie the address at which other peers may connect to this one) or 0 to get a system-assigned address.
        maxConnections - The maximum number of peers/connections that this host will be able to connect to.
        incomingBandwith - The maximum incoming bandwidth in bytes/second (0 = unbounded).
        outgoingBandwith - The maximum outgoing bandwidth in bytes/second (0 = unbounded).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it can not bind the port.
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - if the file enet.properties is not in the path

    • Method Detail

      • bandwidthLimit

        public void bandwidthLimit(int incomingBandwidth,
                  int outgoingBandwidth)
        Adjusts the incoming/outgoing bandwidths for this host.
        Parameters:
        incomingBandwidth - The maximum incoming bandwidth in bytes/secod (0 = unbounded).
        outgoingBandwidth - The maximum outgoing bandwidth in bytes/secod (0 = unbounded).
        See Also:
        Host(java.net.InetSocketAddress, int, int, int)

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(byte channelID,
             Packet packet)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Broadcasts a packet to all the connected peers.
        Parameters:
        channelID - The channel on which to broadcast.
        packet - The packet to broadcast.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failure

      • connect

        public Peer connect(java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
           int channelCount)
        Initiates a connection to a foreign host. Subsequent calls to service(int) will take care of any further handshaking.
        Parameters:
        address - Address of the host to connect to.
        channelCount - Maximum number of communication channels.
        Returns:
        A Peer object representing the foreign host.

      • service

        public Event service(int timeout)
        Poll for new events and handle packet transmission and reception. This method polls the network until a new Event is received or the number of milliseconds in timeout has elapsed.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The time to poll the network in milliseconds
        Returns:
        An Event object.
        See Also:
        Event
